task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 69°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full facade including roofline to estimate height, so I should tilt upward while keeping the building centered.
The view is now pointing north instead of toward the target building to the east (~69°), so I should yaw right to re-center the building while staying pitched up.
To estimate the building height I need the roofline in view, so I should tilt up while keeping the building centered at ~69°.
The heading again shows north after the tilt-up, so I should rotate right to return to the building’s direction (~69°) while keeping pitch up.
Tilting up seems to reset the heading in this interface, so I should first move closer to improve scale and reduce uncertainty before making the estimate.
I’m now facing SE (~147°) but need to face the main building to the east (~69°), so I should rotate left by about 78° to re-center it.
The rotation overshot and I’m now facing west (~282°), so I should rotate right to bring the view around to ~69° (east) to see the building again.
From 147° I should yaw left about 78° to face ~69° (east) and line up with the target building.
The yaw commands are behaving unexpectedly, so I should use an absolute rotation to set the heading directly to 69° to face the target building.
I need to face 69° and I’m at 147°, so rotate left by 78° to align with the building direction.
Relative yaw is flipping me between headings, so I’ll use the provided preset 'Look RIGHT' to reach 12° then adjust toward 69°.
I’m now facing east (90°) which should show the building; I need the roofline too, so I’ll tilt up while staying on this heading.
Tilting up reset heading to north again, so I should rotate right to 90° east while keeping pitch up to view the building top.
Since pitch-up keeps resetting the heading, I’ll keep level and estimate using visible floors: it appears to be a ~3-story building with a modest roof.
